DOC.brief_summary: There significant need culturally adapt effective health education program address rise rate obesity chronic disease concern refugee community . Physical activity identify important prevention tool prevent numerous chronic health condition . This research test feasibility acceptability culturally adapt physical activity intervention sedentary adult Somali woman . Study participant randomize 3-month physical activity program wait-list control group . The primary outcome increase physical activity baseline end program measure pedometer .
DOC.brief_title: Physical Activity Education Program Somali Women
DOC.detailed_description: Participants physical activity program participate 12 weekly 1.5-hour session focus increase physical activity . The group session include participate physical activity well group discussion barrier opportunity increase physical activity daily life . The 12-week program cover educational topic related physical activity ( e.g . overcome barrier activity , exercise safely , relapse prevention strategy ) program gradually increase amount physical activity complete group session course 12 week . Over 3-month wait period , individual wait-list control group offer monthly session health wellness topic offer physical activity program . Measurement visit occur baseline , end the12-week program , approximately 12-weeks end intervention . During measurement session participant complete assessment related physical activity health behavior .
DOC.criteria: Sedentary ( less 90 minute per week moderate vigorous physical activity ) Selfidentify Somali Planning live area next 6 month Ability attend 12weeks inperson group session designate community site Currently pregnant within 3 month delivery BMI great equal 40 Medical condition physical problem interfere physical activity require medical supervision exercise Have another member household participate study Employment one collaborating organization
